captions.text: Welcome to the League of Legends Champion Spotlight featuring Vi, the Piltover Enforcer.
Punch first -- ask questions while punching!
Vi is a melee fighter who relies on devastating punches to break through her competition and take them down.
With her high mobility, damage, and initiation, Vi is great at leading the charge in battle or mopping up fights at the end.
Vi's passive is Blast Shield.  When any of her activated abilities hit an enemy, Vi gets a shield for a few seconds based upon her max health.
Blast Shield has a moderate cooldown before it can be triggered again.
Vault Breaker is a charged ability.  When first cast, Vi slows down and charges up the range and damage.
On the second cast, Vi dashes forward, damaging and knocking back all enemies she hits.
If Vi collides with an enemy champion, she will stop.
I recommend one point in Vault Breaker early and maxing it by level 13 for its great damage output and mobility.
With Denting Blows, every third attack on the same target deals bonus damage based upon her target's maximum health,
shreds some of its armor, and grants Vi bonus attack speed for a few seconds.
Both basic attacks and Vault Breaker apply stacks of Denting Blows.
I recommend taking Denting Blows at level one when jungling, but generally maxing it last.
Excessive Force causes Vi's next basic attack to deal bonus damage to her target as well as all enemies in a cone behind it.
Vi can store up to two charges of Excessive Force to be used one after the other.
I recommend taking Excessive Force at level one when laning and always maxing it by level nine to store charges more quickly.
Assault and Battery is Vi's ultimate.
When activated she dashes to target enemy champion, rendering her immune to crowd control
while knocking aside and damaging enemies she collides with on the way.
Once Vi reaches her target, she damages and knocks it into the air before slamming it back to the ground.
While it can be difficult to match up against ranged champions, remember that Excessive Force can often reach your opponents.
Find an angle where a minion is squarely between you and your opponent, and hit Excessive Force for some quick harass.
Another way to wear your opponents down is to wait in the brush and charge Vault Breaker when they get near.
Nidalee heads up to plant Bushwhack, but a combination of Vault Breaker into a basic attack and Excessive Force makes her regret that decision.
This combo gets even scarier once you learn Denting Blows.
Though Nidalee dodges Vault Breaker, Vi puts herself in front of Nidalee's exit.
Remember that Excessive Force will reset your attack timer, so always activate it immediately after a basic attack to help trigger Denting Blows.
Putting this all together, watch as Vi charges Vault Breaker into a basic attack and Excessive Force -
setting up Nidalee for an easy kill once Master Yi comes to gank.
Getting access to your ultimate - Assault and Battery - opens even more doors.
When fighting against a champion with crowd control, remember that Vi's ultimate renders her immune to these effects.
As Swain casts Nevermove, Assault and Battery charges straight through, allowing Vi to snag a kill in a 1-on-1 duel without stopping.
You'll often want to quickly clear minion waves to roam around the map or head home.
To do this, charge Vault Breaker and let the minions pile up.
Then, plow through them and turn for Excessive Force.
With all the minions dead, feel free to head wherever you like.
If you ever find a key opponent out of position, don't hesitate to charge right in.
Vi finds Caitlyn in a dangerous spot, singling her out with Assault and Battery.
With her team's help, she turns it into a quick kill before charging in for more.
Without the key damage dealer left for the opposition, Vi's team makes quick work of Nunu and Elise for a quick 3-0 fight.
While Vi normally needs all her abilities for damage to take down opponents by herself,
she can rely on teammates for that role and instead use them for mobility.
As Master Yi chases in on Nidalee, she charges Vault Breaker to close the distance and then lands Assault and Battery so he can catch up.
At this point Vi simply tanks the turret damage and chases in on Nidalee, netting a kill through her team's combined efforts.
Vi's goal in a teamfight should be to seek out and destroy the most important targets first.
She charges in on Swain with Vault Breaker, brings him low with Excessive Force and Denting Blows, and creates the first kill of the fight.
Immediately after, she charges Caitlyn with Assault and Battery, taking her out even despite Flash.
From here, a basic attack, Excessive Force, and Vault Breaker set up her team for an ace onto Elise.
I recommend building Vi with a primary focus on physical damage output while splashing in some added durability when convenient.
Try Armor Penetration marks, Armor seals, Magic Resist glyphs, and Attack Damage quintessences.
Take 21/9/0 masteries, focusing on all the physical damage masteries in offense plus bonus armor and health in defense.
I recommend Ignite and Ghost or Flash for summoner spells, allowing you to dive into the battle and deal as much damage as possible.
Thanks for tuning in to the Vi Champion Spotlight. Please subscribe to the Riot Games Youtube channel above and leave us your comments just below the video.

comments.text:
Can someone help me please? I'm really sick and tired of Vi jungle because 
I can never beat her as a jungler. I feel like she's OP after mid-late 
game, because she just snowballs so hard and becomes unkillable and tanky 
while dishing out tons of damage. No matter what champs I pick against her 
(usually it's blind pick and I have no clue what the enemy picks), no 
matter how many times I gank or counter gank (and if I counter jungle, then 
I always lose the duel with her), she'll always snowball or get her team to 
snowball, then mid-late game become unkillable (in my opinion). Not to 
mention when Vi is on my team as jungle, she always ends up playing poorly. 
And whenever the enemy has a Vi jungle they end up being ungodly -_- There 
are literally no guides on how to counter Vi jungle.

Can someone please help me? I'm really tired of losing to Vi jg﻿
comments.author: Imran Ghani

comments.text:
+Imran Ghani I don't know if this will help much, but if you can't beat Vi 
Jungle, then become Vi Jungle. She's not much riot points and getting her 
on your champion roster would be a huge benefit. I think when she's on 
Level 2 her buffs are most vulnerable. But like you said, she is super OP. 
I think it's best to maybe wait 'till she's on the weekly roster and 
practice. If you like her, she's worth the riot points.

comments.text:
Vi, Darius, Riven, Malphite. What do these have in common? they're tanky, 
deal tons of damage, have multiple cc and barely any delay in their 
abilities allowing them to dive straight into 2v1 or even 3v1 and be a 
threat. Aatrox, Gangplank, Mordekaiser, Wukong. What do these have in 
common? compared to the other list they lack in both damage and tanky stats 
and they got bigger delay in they're abilities and all of them got the role 
of fighter and still can't even go 1v1 with most champions! Aatrox can 
barely use any abilities during battle and his w drains more health than 
it's worth plus he's to squishy, wukong is only good if he gets a good 
engage in team fights and manage to poke perfectly, Gangplank got ONE 
damage ability and an ult, Mordekaiser got no cc and no dmg and barely 
anything to even be viable in almost any kind of fight. Why don't they buff 
Aatrox and Mordekaiser at least? i have played ultiple games with Aatrox 
and even when i'm feeded my damage is still only moderate and I still lose 
half my health 3 seconds into a team fight when not focused. All he can do 
is one engage then throw e's or else he dies cause all other fighters can 
cc him and throw entire 4 ability combos before he's finished his q!﻿

comments.text:
It's Oct. 2014 and Vi's gameplay is still full of bugs.

First of all that "Q Bug". Sometimes you can't use your Q spell in a game 
and whatever you do to fix the problem (reconnecting, relaunching the 
client etc) doesn't work. You are being forced to play the rest of the game 
without using your Q. Experienced it many times. It's really annoying to 
play the game with that handicap and also to be have to let your friends 
know about the bug. I even lost ranked game once, just because of that 
sh*t. As you can guess we were winning until that time, but that problem 
completely ruined everything for us and we lost all the team fights after 
that. I never play Vi since then.

Also, never happened to me but I heard some people saying that her E and 
Ulti have some problems too.

Riot, please find a solution for this. It's really frustrating.﻿

comments.text:
+Hurtunknown i main vi and she got me out of silver and into gold. when 
playing vi jungle ALWAYS rush trinity force right after the ad jungle item 
(lizzard something) vi is the best champion in the game to buy trinity 
force acourding to lolking graph, when she is fighting she is constantly 
using abilites so she is cnstantly getting bonus damage from the trinity 
force spellblade. 

i usually folow it up with black cleaver for some pen and sustain. if you 
manage to buy these 3 times before the 30 min mark you will be able to kill 
most targets in a 1v1 really fast.

she is most powerfull in the midgame but after you built 3 ofensive items i 
recomend to almost always go tanky with the remaining 2 items. i like to 
usually build warmongs + banshys / omen but it's situationnal.

but the most important thing is to know her kit inside out and for that you 
just need to practice.

some tips: her e is not only a auto attack reset but it increases her AA 
range by a bit, use this when chasing low health tagets.
when fully engaging charge q, AA e AA AA e and when they use their escape 
move ult. always use your ult as late as possible unless you have alies 
that can help.

hope i helped and have fun

comments.text:
+RandomGuy1994 Yes, apparently you can, I play almost only Vi in ranked and 
I've had it happen a couple of times, where the target dashes/spins away 
just before the knock-up initiates, resulting in you arriving at their 
original destination with them standing next to you laughing.Sucks serious 
ass for the Vi player, but it is possible to dodge the knock-up/grab part 
of the ult.

comments.author: Riften Guard

comments.text:
+Riften Guard That's just another variant of Ashe's, Ezreal's and Draven's 
ult. The difference is that Jinx's ult does pathethic damage should the 
target(s) have full health so it can be used pretty much only to execute 
low hp enemies rather than to deal aoe damage in teamfights.

Vi on the other hand can pretty much anywhere, any time IMMEDIATELY 
shutdown an enemy carry at will without the opposing team being able to do 
*anything* to prevent it.
comments.author: RandomGuy1994

comments.text:
Take a look at Jinx... She can hit an enemy with her Ult from across the 
map. If you're about at... Say 20# health and that ult hits you. Dead. And 
your teamates won't be able to do anything about it, as it might of been 
from across the map.
